intro: Manglilla capororoca, commonly known as the red mangrove, is a tropical plant native to the coastal regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its distinctive red bark and aerial roots. The plant thrives in brackish water environments, often found in mangrove forests along coastal areas. Its leaves are glossy and dark green, and it produces small, fragrant white flowers that attract pollinators. The plant plays a vital role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial species.
